definition: the earliest ancestor/originator (of a tradition, school of thought etc)

sentences.english: Thought to be the ancestor of todays popular Bramble cocktail.
sentences.chinese: 被認爲是當今流行樹莓類雞尾酒的鼻祖。

sentences.english: Adam and Eve played the first game of hide and seek.
sentences.chinese: 亞當和夏娃是“躲貓貓”遊戲的鼻祖。

sentences.english: Boy, it's marvelous. I prefer Neijia to Waijia. Well, who's the forefather of Neijia then?
sentences.chinese: 哇，內家功夫真是神了，我喜歡。誰是它的開山鼻祖？

sentences.english: This is the grandfather of all business creativity books.
sentences.chinese: 它是所有商務創新書籍的鼻祖。

sentences.english: Since then Lianxianglou has been known as the originator of Guangzhou style's lotus seed paste moon cake.
sentences.chinese: 從此，奠定了廣式蓮蓉月餅鼻祖的地位。

sentences.english: It originated with a woman named Okuni or Izumo in the 17th century.
sentences.chinese: 它的鼻祖是17世紀一位叫出去阿國的女性。

sentences.english: Lady Murasaki Shikubu's The Tale of Genji is seen as the first of its kind in literature.
sentences.chinese: 紫式部的《源氏物語》被看作是這類文學的開山鼻祖。

sentences.english: Chaucer is the father of English poetry.
Robert Morrison was the first missionary of Protestant Church to do missionary work in China.
sentences.chinese: 馬禮遜是基督教新教來華傳教的開山鼻祖。

sentences.english: Kafkaesque is a famous contemporary novelist of Austria and one of the originators of modernist school of literature.
sentences.chinese: 卡夫卡是奧地利現代著名小說家，現代派文學的鼻祖。

sentences.english: Cuju is well recognized as the origin of modern football.
sentences.chinese: 被公認爲現代足球運動的鼻祖。

sentences.english: I 400 trillion for the originator of the Han kinds of persons who or Down?
sentences.chinese: 爲吾四百兆漢種之鼻祖者誰乎？

sentences.english: The source of the ancient city of Tang people's Bank, after the founder of Taoism are good American law.
sentences.chinese: 葉氏族人源出古市塘岸，均爲道教鼻祖法善之後裔。

sentences.english: He was extolled as the founder of their Florentine school.
sentences.chinese: 他被稱頌爲佛羅倫薩畫派的鼻祖。

definition: representative individual (of a school of thought)
fashionable for a while (idiom); all the rage
priority/sth advocated first/refers to ancient tradition: Worship the river first, then the sea.
to be known as/to be nicknamed/to be purportedly/to claim (often exaggeratedly or falsely)
